title: Trigonometric Identities - sum identity for sine

content.question: The function ​<math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses theta close parentheses equals sin theta"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Using the fact that <math alttext="pi over 12 equals pi over 4 plus open parentheses negative pi over 6 close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>12</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, what is the value of <math alttext="f open parentheses pi over 12 close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>12</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="negative fraction numerator square root of 2 over denominator 4 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="fraction numerator square root of 2 minus 1 over denominator 2 end fraction"><semantics><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="fraction numerator square root of 6 minus square root of 2 over denominator 4 end fraction"><semantics><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mn>6</mn></msqrt><mo>-</mo><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="fraction numerator square root of 6 plus square root of 2 over denominator 4 end fraction"><semantics><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mn>6</mn></msqrt><mo>+</mo><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="fraction numerator square root of 6 minus square root of 2 over denominator 4 end fraction"><semantics><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mn>6</mn></msqrt><mo>-</mo><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
